byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Erbil, and Eric Schmitt from Qatar and Washington.
byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: United States aims to cripple Islamic State financially by accelerating airstrikes on oil fields ISIS controls in eastern Syria.
lead_paragraph: Frustrated by ISIS militants’ ability to keep producing oil despite airstrikes against refineries, the United States has moved to inflict damage that takes longer to fix.

headline.main: U.S. Steps Up Its Attacks on ISIS-Controlled Oil Fields in Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S. Steps Up Its Attacks on ISIS-Controlled Oil Fields in Syria

snippet: Frustrated by ISIS militants’ ability to keep producing oil despite airstrikes against refineries, the United States has moved to inflict damage that takes longer to fix.
